summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 discussing logistical planning for a briefing between the Department of Justice and victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails involve FBI Victim Services Division personnel, a DOJ coordinator, and victims' attorneys Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell, focusing on selecting a location (likely Florida) and scheduling the meeting.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the attorneys representing Epstein victims who believes Florida is the best location for a victim briefing meeting.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Brad Edwards as an attorney representing Epstein victims, consulted on the logistics for a victim briefing meeting.

connections.description: Both are attorneys representing victims of Jeffrey Epstein, collaborating on logistics for a DOJ victim briefing.

events.title: Planning for Victim Briefing
events.description: Email chain discusses ongoing planning for a Department of Justice briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein, involving coordination between the FBI Victim Services Division, a DOJ coordinator, and victims' attorneys.

events.title: Initial Planning Call for Victim Meeting
events.description: The Department of Justice indicates it is in the early stages of planning a meeting with victims of Epstein and schedules a call to discuss the best way to proceed.

locations: Miramar (mentioned as possible location of FBI field office)
keyFacts: The Department of Justice and FBI were actively planning a briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein in October 2020.
Attorneys Brad Edwards and Paul Cassell, representing victims, were consulted and suggested Florida as the best location for the meeting, citing client locations and pandemic travel concerns.
An FBI building in Broward County (possibly Miramar) was considered as a potential venue for the victim briefing.
The email chain shows coordination between the FBI Victim Services Division and a DOJ National Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Coordinator regarding victim outreach.
Multiple email addresses and names of government personnel are redacted or omitted, indicating standard internal and external correspondence protocols.
